9/16/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Math Mind: The Simple Path to Loving Math
9/16/2024.description:
In her new book,  Math Mind: The Simple Path to Loving Math , Shalinee Sharma, one of the world's top experts on math learning, shows how complex problem-solving and puzzle solving, abstract and logical thinking, developing fluency with numbers, and cultivating persistence in math are crucial skills for success that can be taught to everyone and how math, far from being a dry, dull exercise, shares common ground with art and creativity. She also debunks the myths that prevent us from learning and enjoying math, with chapters dedicated to the three roadblocks that discourage adults and kids from learning.



 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/math-mi... 

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/571725037...

9/17/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Above the Noise: My Story of Chasing Calm
9/17/2024.description:
DeMar DeRozan, six-time NBA All-Star, has been called a "basketball savant" (ESPN) and "the best closer in the NBA" (GQ)-but when he went public with his depression, it sparked a conversation that reached far beyond the court. By breaking the stigma of speaking out, he added a new, seldom-heard voice to the mental health dialogue: a successful Black male athlete, openly naming his pain and advocating for others to do the same. Now it's time to tell the full story. Born and raised in Compton, DeRozan was no stranger to hardship-living in poverty, losing friends to gang violence. In worn-out school gyms and community centers, fueled by hunger and a desire to prove himself, he started to rise, but doubts followed. In  Above the Noise: My Story of Chasing Calm , DeRozan opens up about his proudest triumphs and the times he felt so weighed down he couldn't get out of bed. He reflects on what it took to make a name for himself in a new country after getting drafted by the Toronto Raptors, the pressure of playing with veteran athletes as a twenty-year-old rookie, and the pain of losing role models.



 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/above-t... 

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/471725130...

9/19/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Dismantling Mass Incarceration: A Handbook for Change
9/19/2024.description:
In this pathbreaking reader, three of the nation's leading advocates-Premal Dharia, James Forman Jr., and Maria Hawilo-provide tools to move from despair and critique to hope and action.  Dismantling Mass Incarceration: A Handbook for Change  surveys various approaches to confronting the carceral state, exploring bold but practical interventions involving police, prosecutors, public defenders, judges, prisons, and even life after prison. Rather than prescribing solutions, the book offers a forum for discussions-and disagreements-about how to best confront the harms of mass incarceration. The contributors range from noted figures such as Angela Y. Davis, Clint Smith, Ph.D. (FAN '23), Emily Bazelon (FAN '13, '19), and Larry Krasner to local organizers, advocates, scholars, lawyers, and judges, as well as people who have been incarcerated.



 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/dismant... 

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/891725198...

9/20/2024.description:

Dr. Nakhlis is a Doctor of Optometry and has been practicing for 20 years. She attended the University of Illinois Chicago, IL where she received her Bachelor of Science in Biology and then she completed her doctorate degree at Illinois College of Optometry Chicago, IL. She specializes in myopia control in children and ocular surface diseases and she is the proud owner of two optometry clinics in the Northern Suburbs of Chicago. Freshman through seniors can attend.

9/25/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Class Dismissed: When Colleges Ignore Inequality & Students Pay the Price
9/25/2024.description:
Elite colleges are boasting unprecedented numbers with respect to diversity, with some schools admitting their first majority-minority classes. But when the twin pandemics of COVID-19 and racial unrest gripped the world, schools scrambled to figure out what to do with the diversity they so fervently recruited. And disadvantaged students suffered. In his new book,  Class Dismissed: When Colleges Ignore Inequality and Students Pay the Price , Anthony Abraham Jack, Ph.D. exposes how woefully unprepared colleges were to support these students and shares their stories of how they were left to weather the storm alone and unprotected.



 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/class-d... 

  

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/581725295...

9/26/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Hope for Cynics: The Surprising Science of Human Goodness
9/26/2024.description:
We don't have to remain stuck in this cynicism trap. Through science and storytelling, Jamil Zaki, Ph.D. (FAN '19), director of the Stanford Social Neuroscience Laboratory and author of the new book  Hope for Cynics: The Surprising Science of Human Goodness , imparts the secret for beating back cynicism: hopeful skepticism-thinking critically about people and our problems, while honoring and encouraging our strengths. Far from being naïve, hopeful skepticism is a precise way of understanding others that can rebalance our view of human nature and help us build the world we truly want.



 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/hope-fo... 

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/431725314...

9/30/2024.name: CCC Presents: Financial Aid Night
9/30/2024.description:
The College Career Center will hold its annual Financial Aid Night at 7 p.m. on Monday, Sept. 30 at the Performing Arts Center and live-streamed via Zoom ( https://zoom.us/j/95296140065 ). This event will be recorded and the slides and recording will be available on the College Career Center website within a week of the event.

Post Secondary Counselors Ms. Sara Hanson and Mr. Dan Miller will partner with Mr. Jerry Cebrzynski, Associate Vice President for Financial Aid at Lake Forest College, for this presentation, which is meant primarily for families who have current juniors or seniors.

Details about applying for college financial assistance through the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) will be discussed, along with the types of financial aid available, and how eligibility for aid is determined. Families with seniors typically complete their FAFSA form in October (for the class of 2025, the FAFSA will open on December 1st).
9/30/2024.location: Stevenson High School | Performing Arts Center & Zoom

9/30/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Holding It Together: How Women Became America's Safety Net
9/30/2024.description:
Holding it Together: How Women Became America's Social Safety Net  draws on five years of research in which Calarco, a sociologist and associate professor at the University of Wisconsin-Madison, surveyed over 4,000 parents and conducted more than 400 hours of interviews with women who bear the brunt of our broken system. Tracing present-day policies back to their roots, Calarco reveals a systematic agreement to dismantle our country's social safety net and persuade citizens to accept precarity while women bear the brunt. She leads us to see women's labor as the reason we've gone so long without the support systems that our peer nations take for granted, and how women's work maintains the illusion that we don't need a net.

 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/holding... 

  

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/101725453...

10/5/2024.name: 2024 Fall Play: Anon(ymous)
10/5/2024.description:
Separated from his mother, a young refugee named Anon embarks on a perilous journey across the United States, encountering a diverse array of characters-some compassionate, others dangerously cruel. From a sinister one-eyed butcher to charming barflies and a special curry restaurant, Anon must navigate an unpredictable, ever-changing landscape to reunite with his family. "Anon(ymous)," commissioned by the Children's Theatre Company of Minneapolis and written in 2006 by Japanese-American playwright Naomi Iizuka, reimagines Homer's The Odyssey through the eyes of a modern-day refugee. The play explores serious themes as our young hero makes life-altering decisions-some lives are saved, while others are lost. With its captivating blend of magical realism and ensemble storytelling, "Anon(ymous)" resonates with our shared human quest for belonging and how we are shaped along the way.

  *Patriot Theatre Company advises Anon(ymous) has mature content due to moments of discrimination and violence. This production runs approximately 90 minutes with no intermission and utilizes moments of flashing lights, lights directed at the audience, and a6 6tmospheric fog.  

 TICKETS: 
 *    Saturday, Oct. 5 @ 2 p.m.   


*    Saturday, Oct. 5 @ 7 p.m.   


*    Sunday, Oct. 6 @ 2 p.m.   


*  DOWNLOAD: Event Program
10/5/2024.location: Stevenson High School | The Little Theatre (Room 4200)

10/7/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Meditations for Mortals: Four Weeks to Embrace Your Limitations and Make Time for What Counts
10/7/2024.description:
Burkeman's occasional newsletter  The Impefectionist  is just ... perfect. Each missive has nugget after nugget of insight and brilliance and compassion and humor about grind culture, the overlords of "productivity" and "success," the demands on our attention, the importance of "enough." His earlier book  Four Thousand Weeks  (the number of weeks you'll live if you are lucky to make it to 80) is a huge bestseller, with countless tribute from readers who liberated their lives from the dreary fantasy of getting it all done. His new book is soooo great, and we are completely gobsmacked that we get to host him. NOT TO BE MISSED.







 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/meditat...

10/8/2024.name: CCC Features: College Essay Workshop
10/8/2024.description:
The Student Learning Program will be hosting a Common App editing workshop for seniors on Tuesday, October 8th, from 5:00 PM to 7:00 PM in room 2104. This workshop is designed for students who have already completed their Common App essays and are looking to revise and refine their work before the October 15th application deadline.

To participate, students must complete the  Google Form  found on the ILC/ELC Canvas page. Space is limited, so be sure to apply soon!

This workshop is designed to help you enhance your Common App essay for college applications, with an emphasis on editing your drafts for final submission. Please note that this session is not intended for brainstorming; participants should come prepared with a completed draft. To attend, please submit the Google Form by  October 4, 2024.

10/9/2024.description:
No, we are NOT done hosting the incredible folks from Stanford's d.school! This time, we get two of the top leaders of the school discussing their amazingly conceived (and illustrated) book about futures thinking, rectifying the mistakes of the past, and the power we each have to create the future we want. This is a civics topic, a history topic, a psychology topic, an education topic, parenting, too, and more. We're fortunate to have the extra-extra Liz Gerber to lead the conversation, herself a d.school alum, and just so dang open and smart. A great night for all.

10/14/2024.name: Family Action Network presents:The Architecture of Urbanity: Designing for Nature, Culture, and Joy
10/14/2024.description:
Chakrabarti is one of the top architects and designers working today, and a media-savvy writer and opiner who loves, LOVES cities, and has a clear, astounding vision for how to create "ecological urbanism." He aims for design that is fully inclusive, responsive to cultural, racial, and socioeconomic concerns. He is a pragmatic optimist, and is a leading voice on the possibilities of public spaces. His interlocutor, Reed Kroloff, is the dean of the school of architecture at IIT in Chicago. A necessary, intelligent, future-forward topic.









 Links

10/16/2024.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: You're an ADULT!? What to Expect When Your Teen Turns 18
10/16/2024.description:
Congratulations! Your teen is 18! Do you know that also means they are an ADULT?!

Join Alan Press and Caren Naidoff from the Shire Law Group for this virtual discussion. They will discuss what actions you need to take as your teen's legal guardian and talk about how your rights to your teen's financial, medical, and education records change. Alan and Caren will also advise participants on the steps to take so they can help with medical and financial matters for their young adult.














 Links  * Zoom Link:  https://zoom.us/j/93112369571

10/16/2024.name: CCC Presents: Career Talks w/ Joe Taborek (Global VP of Sales/Chief Revenue Officer)
10/16/2024.description:
Join us virtually on Wednesday, October 16th from 7 - 8 p.m. as Mr. Joe Taborek will discuss his career as the Global VP of Sales/Chief Revenue Officer.

Mr.Taborek received his BS in Finance (Indiana University), and his career spans many stops across enterprise software, from selling as an individual contributor to the executive positions he held later in his career.

Currently, he runs all Go To Market functions for the software company he works for. At the core of his work is sales, but the different teams that report to him across GTM are Marketing, Sales, Professional Services, Customer Success, and Customer Support. Within those teams, many jobs come together to deliver increasing and predictable revenue and success for the company. These functions comprise how the company markets, sells, delivers solutions, and makes its customers successful.

If you are interested in attending, please complete this Google Form below. You will be sent the Zoom link via email before the presentation after you sign up. Please email Ms. Travis ( jtravis@d125.org ) with any questions.





 Registration :  https://forms.gle/2Pfv1nxdnE9dejV98

10/17/2024.name: Yearbook Photo Re-Take Day
10/17/2024.description:
View your School Portraits, and select your yearbook/class picture before Retake Day!
 * *The final deadline is two weeks after retake day; if you do not pick an image VIP will choose a yearbook image for you*
* To view your student's school portraits look for an email sent to you by "Visual Image Photography", or go to  vipis.com 
* Retake pictures will be taken on  Thur   10/17/24 & Fri 10/18/24 (10 a.m. - 3:30 p.m. - Recital Hall) . This is for students who have not yet taken a Yearbook Portrait this year, or for students who have reported a need for a new picture
* Retake photos will be added to your online image gallery about a week after photo day
* If you have any questions, please email  support@vipis.com 
 
Seniors who took a photo on School Picture Day AND paid for a "VIP Premier Senior Portrait Session" -- the image you choose from your Premier Session gallery will be your yearbook selection. If you'd rather use an image taken during the fall School Picture Day instead, please contact  support@vipis.com

10/17/2024.name: Fall Orchestra Concert
10/17/2024.description:
The Fall Orchestra Concert will feature students from all curricular orchestra classes in their first performance event of the year. The musical highlights will be centered around music with dark, spooky themes, contrasting with high energy and lush selections. A treat for the eyes and ears!

This concert is always exciting, as it is a premiere for each of our new ensembles and the first time on our SHS concert stage for many new students. The fall themes really help color the event into something special!
 Links 

 *  Streaming via Vimeo 
*  DOWNLOAD: Event Program
10/17/2024.location: Stevenson High School | Performing Arts Center

10/17/2024.name: CCC Presents: Career Talks w/ Dr, Dhruv Kumar Internal Medicine Physician
10/17/2024.description:
Join us virtually on Thursday, October 17th from 7 - 8 p.m. as Mr. Dhruv Kumar will discuss his career as an Internal Medicine Physician.

Mr.Kumar completed his undergraduate education at UIUC, attended Loyola University for medical school, and completed his Residency in Michigan. Currently, he works as an Assistant Professor in the Department of Medicine and as a Physician. He works with medical students, residents, and is a part of many committees surrounding the medical field.

If you are interested in attending, please complete the Google Form below. You will be sent the Zoom link via email before the presentation after you sign-up. Please email Ms. Travis ( jtravis@d125.org ) with any questions.







 Registration :  https://forms.gle/4cWX17ubcABJWhLDA

10/17/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Leaders as Futurists: Cultivating Civic Imagination for a Dynamic World
10/17/2024.description:
We met Solomon at Bob Sutton's After-Hours event this past May, and WOW, we were knocked over by her energy, generosity, openheartedness, and super-quick mind. THEN we learned that she's a "Futurist in Residence" at Stanford's d. school (wondering if they have any job openings?), and THEN we learned that she is obsessed with creating structures for civic thinking and civic engagement. Sign us up!! Great program for election season, and for those of you (all of you!) who would love to have a conversation about civil discourse and the future of democracy that doesn't devolve instantaneously into freeze-dried polarization. Liz Gerber works with Lisa on various projects, and we can't wait to jump in with these two geniuses!









 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/leaders... 

  







  

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/831727556...

10/18/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Twenty-Four Seconds from Now: An Evening with Jason Reynolds
10/18/2024.description:
Jason Reynolds is ALL THAT, full stop, and we are pinching ourselves that he will be in-person, on stage, for FAN. Such a powerful writer, and an empathetic, giving, charismatic presence. He's devoted his career to young kids and teens, and has won just about every award and honor available. His rep told us that he has memorized the first chapter of the new book, and will be doing a theatrical recitation of it on stage for FAN -- and did we mention we're giving away a boatload of books at the event?? The target audience for the book is high-school aged kids, not elementary or middle school, FYI. Bring everyone you know, and everyone they know, no joke.









 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/twenty-...

10/21/2024.name: District 125 Board of Education Meeting
10/21/2024.description: Please visit the  Board of Education webpage  for additional information.
10/21/2024.location: District 125 Administration Building, 2 Stevenson Drive, Lincolnshire, IL

10/21/2024.name: Family Action Network presents: Polostan: An Evening with Neal Stephenson
10/21/2024.description:
Yes, this is an outlier topic for FAN, but soooooo worth it! Stephenson is arguably the most prominent "speculative fiction" writer alive today, selling millions of books. Is his work science fiction, historical fiction, cyberpunk? His most revered books include 1992's  Snow Crash  (which coined the term "metaverse" and we all know what that is now, 30 years later) and 1999's  Cryptonomicon . This is a straight-up nerds and geeks program, and for those who know, they will be over the moon to meet their hero. A great night to expand your horizons and stop doom-scrolling the election season.









 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/polosta... 

  







  

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://bit.ly/StephensonFANEvent 

  



  

  

  

  

  

  

<a href="http://www.d125.org/forward.cfm?dest=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs%2Egoogle%2Ecom%2Fforms%2Fd%2Fe%2F1FAIpQLSduQSPAxzdzF20&destkey=443E9A581F00B9EC53DCCD028C2A4DB4887D8DA7EFA3EC66DDDEAC15C62C2B41

10/25/2024.name: Catalyst presents: 1st Annual Catalympics
10/25/2024.description:
The Summer Games may be over but the Olympics have come to Stevenson!

Join Catalyst for our 1st Annual Catalympics on October 25. Student teams of 2-3 can compete in a thrilling tournament of fun-filled sports including pickleball, spikeball, and basketball in the Sports Center after school from 4-6 pm. Prizes will be awarded to the winning team for each sport. Tickets are $5 per person; teams of 2-3 can register to compete in Catalympics via GoFan using this link:  https://gofan.co/event/1720920?schoolId=IL15688 .

Registration closes Oct. 15 so register your team today!
